Class PlayerController

java.lang.Object
game.core.PlayerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class PlayerController extends Object implements KeyListener
Handles keyboard input for controlling the Player character.

This class listens for key events to move the player left and right, apply acceleration and friction, and control jumping behavior. It also updates the player's animation based on current movement.

The controller implements a physics-based movement system with:

  • Gradual acceleration when movement keys are pressed
  • Maximum speed limits to prevent excessive velocity
  • Friction to slow the player when no movement keys are pressed
  • Jump mechanics with a single-jump limitation (until landing)

Control scheme:

  • Left movement: Left arrow key or A key
  • Right movement: Right arrow key or D key
  • Jump: Up arrow key or W key

  • Field Details

    • player

      private final Player player
      The Player character that this controller manipulates. This reference is used to modify the player's velocity and animation state.

    • speed

      private float speed
      Current horizontal speed of the player. This value is updated on key presses and applies friction when no key is pressed.

      Positive values move the player right, negative values move the player left. The magnitude is capped by maxSpeed.

    • maxSpeed

      private final float maxSpeed
      The maximum horizontal speed the player can reach (in units/second).

      This value caps both positive (rightward) and negative (leftward) movement to prevent the player from moving too quickly.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • acceleration

      private final float acceleration
      The acceleration value applied when the left or right movement keys are held down. The final speed is clamped by maxSpeed.

      Higher values make the player accelerate more quickly, creating a more responsive but potentially less precise control feel.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • friction

      private final float friction
      The friction value applied each frame when no movement key is pressed, causing the player to gradually slow down horizontally.

      This value is applied as a multiplier: speed *= (1 - friction). Higher values make the player stop more quickly when no key is pressed.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • canJump

      private boolean canJump
      A flag indicating whether the player is currently allowed to jump. This is typically reset when the player lands on a solid surface.

      This prevents the player from performing multiple jumps while airborne, implementing a single-jump mechanic common in platformer games.

    • keyIsPressed

      private boolean keyIsPressed
      A boolean indicating whether a movement key (left or right) is currently pressed. Used to apply friction when no key is pressed.

      When true, the player maintains their current speed (subject to acceleration). When false, friction is applied to gradually slow the player down.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerController

      public PlayerController(Player player)
      Constructs a PlayerController for the specified player.

      This controller will modify the player's velocity based on keyboard input and update the player's animation state accordingly.

      Parameters:
      player - The Player character to control. Must not be null.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the player's movement on each frame.

      This method applies friction if no movement key is pressed. Otherwise, the player maintains their current horizontal speed (bounded by maxSpeed). The vertical velocity is preserved from the player's current velocity.

      This method should be called once per frame in the game loop to ensure smooth movement and proper physics application.

    • resetJump

      public void resetJump()
      Resets the ability to jump, allowing the player to jump again on the next jump input. Typically called when the player lands on a platform or ground.

      This method is usually invoked by collision detection code when the player makes contact with a surface that can be jumped from.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      Handles key press events for movement (left, right) and jumping (up).

      Pressing left or right modifies the horizontal speed by acceleration. Pressing up performs a jump if canJump is true.

      Supported keys:

      • Left movement: Left arrow key or A key
      • Right movement: Right arrow key or D key
      • Jump: Up arrow key or W key

      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent triggered when a key is pressed.

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      Handles key release events to detect when movement keys are no longer pressed.

      When movement keys (left/right or A/D) are released, this method sets keyIsPressed to false, which allows friction to be applied in the update() method.

      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent triggered when a key is released.

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e)
      Unused method for handling key typed events (not needed for game controls).

      This method is part of the KeyListener interface but is not used for game control purposes. Key typed events represent character input rather than physical key presses, which are not relevant for movement controls.

      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent triggered when a key is typed.
